procedures.title: Quick Start Tips
steps: Remove grate(s) and drip tray(s), clean both.
Insert the drip tray(s) into the bottom of grill.
Fill the drip tray(s) with 2 cups of liquid.
Adjust control setting for type of food.
Preheat grill with the lid closed for 5 - 7 minutes.
Once cool, place grate/griddle in the dishwasher.
Clean out the drip tray contents.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is ready for use with optimal performance.

procedures.title: Before Using the Grill
steps: Remove the cooking grate and drip tray from the grill.
Wash the grill with warm soapy water using a non-abrasive cloth.
Insert the drip tray all the way into the bottom of grill.
Cover the bottom of the drip tray with a liquid.
Clean the grilling surface after each use.
Place your cooking grate or optional griddle onto the element with drip tray installed.
Preheat grill with the lid closed for 5 - 7 minutes.
Close the lid and cook.
Clean up after the grill has cooled to the touch.
Remove the grate and place in your dishwasher.
Lift up the electric elements and remove the drip tray.
Wash the lid in the dishwasher if needed.
Clean the grill after it has cooled enough to handle.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is prepared for cooking with reduced smoke and optimal performance.

procedures.title: Operation - Turning On
preconditions: Grill is connected to power supply
steps: Touch the controls firmly with the flat part of your fingertips.
With the unit unlocked, touch the POWER button in the main control frame.
Activate the element by holding the element power button in the control frame for 2 seconds and choosing a cooking option.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is powered on and ready for cooking.

procedures.title: Operation - Cooking Mode Options
steps: Select the desired cooking mode: Heat Level or Temperature Cooking Mode.
For Heat Level Cooking Mode, swipe your finger along the temperature control arc and release at the desired setting.
For Temperature Cooking Mode, select the desired cooking temperature by touching the thermometer/gradient graphic.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is set to the desired cooking mode and temperature.

procedures.title: Operation - Timer Options
steps: Activate the main power and touch the timer clock graphic within the element control frame.
Set the desired time duration by touching the + and – buttons.
Touch the timer button to start.
procedures.expected_outcome: Timer is set and will alert when cooking time is complete.

procedures.title: Installation - Unpacking the Grill
steps: Carefully unpack the grill from its shipping container.
Verify and identify the package contents.
Check the Electrical Supply Requirements.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is unpacked and ready for installation.

procedures.title: Installation - Countertop Preparation
steps: Plan installation keeping dimensions in mind.
Ensure proper ventilation of the space below the countertop.
Seal the edge of the countertop beneath the trim flange with a NON-ADHESIVE such as Plumber's Putty.
procedures.expected_outcome: Countertop is prepared for grill installation.

procedures.title: Installation - Drain Connection
steps: Attach the 5/8" ID flexible hose to the 1/2" NPT brass pipe fitting and 90º brass elbow.
Ensure the portable version has the brass pipe plug installed if not using the drain.
procedures.expected_outcome: Drain is connected for built-in models or sealed for portable models.

procedures.title: Error Code Readout
preconditions: Grill is powered on and experiencing issues
steps: Identify the error code displayed on the control readout.
Refer to the Troubleshooting Index for the error code.
Take action as noted in the Troubleshooting Index.
De-power and re-start the unit to clear the display.
Lock out the main power supply to the unit by closing the breaker before performing any wiring operations.
Contact Kenyon Customer Care if the problem persists.
procedures.expected_outcome: Error is identified and resolved or escalated to customer care.

procedures.title: Quick Start Tips
preconditions: Grill must be unpacked and installed
steps: Remove grate(s) and drip tray(s), clean both.
Insert the drip tray(s) into the bottom of grill.
Fill the drip tray(s) with 2 cups of liquid.
Adjust control setting for type of food.
Preheat grill with the lid closed for 5 - 7 minutes.
Once cool, place grate/griddle in the dishwasher.
Clean out the drip tray contents.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is ready for use and clean for next use.

procedures.title: Before Using the Grill
preconditions: Grill must be unpacked and installed
steps: Remove the cooking grate and drip tray from the grill.
Wash the grill with warm soapy water using a non-abrasive cloth.
Insert the drip tray all the way into the bottom of grill.
Cover the bottom of the drip tray with a liquid.
Clean the grilling surface after each use.
Place your cooking grate or optional griddle onto the element with drip tray installed.
Preheat grill with the lid closed for 5 - 7 minutes on desired heat setting.
Close the lid and cook.
Clean up after the grill has cooled to the touch.
Remove the grate and place in your dishwasher.
Lift up the electric elements and remove the drip tray.
Wash the lid in the dishwasher if needed.
Clean the grill after it has cooled.
Wipe the stainless steel surfaces with a damp cloth.
Use stainless steel cleaner once a month.
Clean the touch control area with a glass cleaner.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is clean and ready for use.

procedures.title: Operation - Turning On
preconditions: Grill must be installed and connected to power
steps: Touch the controls firmly with the flat part of your fingertips.
With the unit unlocked, touch the POWER button in the main control frame.
Activate the element by holding the element power button in the control frame for 2 seconds and choosing a cooking option.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is turned on and ready for cooking.

procedures.title: Operation - Cooking Mode Options
steps: Select the desired cooking mode: Heat Level or Temperature Cooking Mode.
For Heat Level Cooking Mode, swipe your finger along the temperature control arc and release at the desired setting.
For Temperature Cooking Mode, select the desired cooking temperature by touching the thermometer/gradient graphic.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is set to the desired cooking mode and temperature.

procedures.title: Operation - Timer Options
steps: Activate the main power and touch the timer clock graphic within the element control frame.
Set the desired time duration by touching the + and – buttons.
Touch the timer button to start.
procedures.expected_outcome: Timer is set and will alert when time elapses.

procedures.title: Installation - Unpacking the Grill
steps: Carefully unpack the grill from its shipping container.
Verify and identify the package contents.
Check the Electrical Supply Requirements.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is unpacked and ready for installation.

procedures.title: Installation - Countertop Preparation
steps: Plan installation keeping dimensions in mind.
Ensure proper ventilation of the space below the countertop.
Make countertop cutout with appropriate radius.
Seal the edge of the countertop beneath the trim flange with Plumber's Putty.
procedures.expected_outcome: Countertop is prepared for grill installation.

procedures.title: Installation - Drain Connection
steps: Attach the 5/8" ID flexible hose to the 1/2" NPT brass pipe fitting and 90º brass elbow.
Ensure the portable version has the brass pipe plug installed if not using the drain.
procedures.expected_outcome: Drain is connected for built-in models or sealed for portable models.

procedures.title: Error Code Readout
preconditions: Grill must be turned on and experiencing an issue
steps: Identify the error code displayed on the control readout.
Refer to the Troubleshooting Index for the error code.
Take action as noted in the Troubleshooting Index.
De-power and re-start the unit to clear the display.
Lock out the main power supply to the unit by closing the breaker before performing any wiring operations.
Contact Kenyon Customer Care if the problem persists.
procedures.expected_outcome: Error is identified and resolved or escalated to customer care.

analysis.issue: Model is grouping related procedures into high-level categories instead of splitting them into individual step-by-step processes
analysis.solution: Prompt needs to be more explicit about splitting compound procedures into individual steps

procedures.title: Safety Instructions
steps: Read all instructions prior to using the grill.
Do not touch hot surfaces. Use handles or knobs.
To protect against electrical shock, do not immerse cord or plugs in water or other liquid.
Close supervision is necessary when any appliances are used near children.
Disconnect from power source when not in use and before cleaning. Allow to cool before putting on or taking off parts.
If the surface is cracked, switch off the appliance to avoid the possibility of electric shock.
Do not operate appliance with damaged wires. If the appliance malfunctions, discontinue use.
Ensure grill is installed per instructions and properly grounded by a qualified electrician.
Do not use water to extinguish a grease fire, use dry chemical fire extinguisher.
The appliance is suitable for outdoor use.
The power wires should be regularly examined for signs of damage, and if the cord is damaged, the appliance must not be used.
The appliance is to be connected to a DC power supply that is protected by a 30-amp circuit breaker.
The appliance must be supplied through a residual current device (RCD) having a rated residual operating current not exceeding 30A.
procedures.expected_outcome: Safe operation of the grill.

procedures.title: Unpacking and Setup
steps: Carefully unpack the grill from its shipping container.
Verify and identify the package contents.
Remove the protective plastic film from the lid, trim flange, and glass panel.
Clean the grill before first use with a stainless steel or glass cleaner.
Wash the nonstick coated grates in warm soapy water before using the grill.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is unpacked and ready for installation.

procedures.title: Countertop Preparation and Installation
steps: Ensure the countertop is prepared with the correct cutout dimensions.
Seal the edge of the countertop beneath the trim flange with a non-adhesive such as Plumber's Putty.
Allow a 2 inch minimum clearance between the bottom of the grill and combustible surfaces.
Ensure adequate ventilation of the space below the countertop.
Install the grill according to the provided instructions.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is securely installed in the countertop.

procedures.title: Drain Connection
steps: Attach the 5/8" ID flexible hose to the 1/2" NPT brass pipe fitting and 90º brass elbow on the grill.
Ensure the hose is properly connected for drainage.
procedures.expected_outcome: Proper drainage setup for the grill.

procedures.title: Operation - Turning On
steps: Touch the controls firmly with the flat part of your fingertips.
With the unit unlocked, touch the POWER button in the main control frame.
Activate the element by holding the element power button in the control frame for 2 seconds and choosing a cooking option.
If the element is not activated within 15 seconds, the grill will de-power by itself.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is powered on and ready for cooking.

procedures.title: Operation - Cooking Mode Options
steps: Select either a heating level ranging from low to high or a specific cooking temperature.
For heat level cooking mode, swipe your finger along the temperature control arc and release at the desired setting.
For temperature cooking mode, select the desired cooking temperature by touching the thermometer/gradient graphic.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is set to the desired cooking mode and temperature.

procedures.title: Operation - Safety Lock Feature
steps: Activate the lock feature as a safety measure at any time whether the grill is ON or OFF.
Locking the grill when it is ON will deactivate the power settings from adjusting up or down.
Locking the grill when it is OFF will deactivate all functions of the control panel until it is unlocked.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill controls are locked for safety.

procedures.title: Operation - Timer Options
steps: Activate the main power and touch the timer clock graphic within the element control frame.
Set the desired time duration by touching the + and – buttons.
Touch the timer button to start the timer.
The cooking timer can be activated to shut the heating element off at the end of the set time.
procedures.expected_outcome: Timer is set and will alert or shut off the grill as programmed.

procedures.title: Cleaning and Maintenance
steps: Allow the grill to cool before cleaning.
Remove the cooking grate and drip tray from the grill.
Wash the grill with warm soapy water using a non-abrasive cloth.
Clean the drip tray after each use to prevent possible fire.
Wipe the stainless steel surfaces with a damp cloth to remove any residue.
Use a stainless steel cleaner once a month to keep the grill looking like new.
procedures.expected_outcome: Grill is clean and maintained for optimal performance.

procedures.title: Error Code Resolution
steps: In the event of an error code, identify the code in the Troubleshooting Index.
E04: Allow unit to cool. Ensure correct cooking utensil type is used. Lower the cooking level or temperature setting.
E06, E07, E08, E09: Refer to Kenyon Customer Care.
E10: Re-power unit and command one control input at a time.
procedures.expected_outcome: Error codes are resolved and grill is functioning correctly.

analysis.improvement: Enhanced prompt successfully separated safety, maintenance, and error handling into individual procedures
analysis.remaining_issue: Operation - Cooking Mode Options still groups Heat Level and Temperature modes together
analysis.solution: Need even more explicit instruction to split modes: 'CRITICAL: If a procedure mentions multiple modes, create separate procedures for EACH mode'
